title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5002.2 - Special rules and regulations pertaining to members with a date of membership after June 30, 1973, but before July 27, 1976, interpreting subdivision b of section 446 of the Retirement and Social Security Law
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5002.2 - Special rules and regulations pertaining to members with a date of membership after June 30, 1973, but before July 27, 1976, interpreting subdivision b of section 446 of the Retirement and Social Security Law

State Regulations
(a) Credit for service which predates the
date of entry into the system may be granted without the member being required
to render a minimum of five years of credited service after July 1, 1973, provided such service is otherwise creditable, and either: (1)
was rendered by an employee during which
employment he became a member of the system; or
(2)
was rendered by an employee during which
employment he was ineligible to join a public retirement system. (b) Service rendered by an employee
during which employment he became a member of the system shall be defined as
follows: (1)

Previous service which was
rendered by an employee during which employment he became a member of the
system shall mean continuous employment with the same employer during which he
joined the system. (2)
service as an itinerant substitute teacher on a day-to-day basis shall be
considered as separate employment for each day of such service. Notes
